sn12.1:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn12.1:4.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn12.1:4.7: “Mendicants, I will teach you dependent origination.
sn12.1:4.8: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
sn12.1:5.2: Ignorance is a condition for choices.
sn12.1:5.3: Choices are a condition for consciousness.
sn12.1:5.4: Consciousness is a condition for name and form.
sn12.1:5.5: Name and form is a condition for the six sense fields.
sn12.1:5.6: The six sense fields are conditions for contact.
sn12.1:5.7: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn12.1:5.8: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn12.1:5.9: Craving is a condition for grasping.
sn12.1:5.10: Grasping is a condition for future existence.
sn12.1:5.11: Future existence is a condition for rebirth.
sn12.1:5.12: Rebirth is a condition that gives rise to old age and death, sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress.
sn12.1:5.13: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.1:6.1: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease.
sn12.1:6.3: When consciousness ceases, name and form cease.
sn12.1:6.4: When name and form cease, the six sense fields cease.
sn12.1:6.5: When the six sense fields cease, contact ceases.
sn12.1:6.9: When grasping ceases, future existence ceases.
sn12.1:6.10: When future existence ceases, rebirth ceases.
sn12.1:6.11: When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress cease.
sn12.1:6.12: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
sn12.1:6.13: This is what the Buddha said.
sn12.1:6.14: Uplifted, the mendicants approved of what the Buddha said.
